intro: Lachnagrostis uda, commonly known as slender needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green or brown in color. Lachnagrostis uda is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and sandy soils. It plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its morphological features and ecological adaptability.
